document_data.name: Cloud Shape
document_data.refs2e: <ref name=ALAY-p24">{{Cite organized play/LC/Air's Looking at You|24}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Cloud shape''''' was an [[alteration]] [[spell]],<ref name=ALAY-p24" /> developed by the [[air]] [[elementalist]] [[Mortimer Lightfoot]] in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]],<ref name=ALAY-p16">{{Cite organized play/LC/Air's Looking at You|16}} that allowed one to manipulate the shape of clouds.<ref name=ALAY-p24" />
document_data.Effects: One or more clouds within a {{SIAdj|1000|yard|long=yes}} radius could be manipulated by the caster into limitless number of shapes for an unlimited duration. The spell also allowed the caster to "stretch" clouds out to twice their original size and join multiple clouds together. The inherent nature of the cloud would be left unaffected.<ref name=ALAY-p24" />
document_data.Components: In addition to requiring [[somatic]] and [[verbal component]]s, ''cloud shape'' required a [[material component]], which took the form of the cloud that was to be used by the spell.<ref name=ALAY-p24" />
document_data.History: In the mid–14{{th}} century DR, Mortimer Lightfoot and a group of other rogue elementalists known as the [[Circle of Four]] used ''cloud shape'', alongside Mortimer's other spell ''[[solid cloud]]'', to create a sort of [[cloud palace]] that they used to imprison their kidnapped victims.<ref name=ALAY-p16" />
